comment.body: Make sure you sign the zite.

@Krixano: You can get to this by dragging the button at the top right to the left and scrolling all the way down. First click Sign, then Publish. Not sure if this is your problem or not but people have forgotten to sign in the past.
@Zerov: You might need to open port 15441.
@Zerov: What do you mean by you don't have a public IP?
@Krixano: Your router should have a public IP afaik.
http://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/faq/#do-i-need-to-have-a-port-opened (clearnet)
The only thing I can think of is port forwarding the 15441 port on your router.

Although I don't know if it would error out if you didn't sign *both* content.json files, because it looks like you have two. Sorry if you already did that too, I'm just trying to go through things that could be wrong.
@Zerov: No problem. The only two things I can think of right now is either the port or not signing the `data/users/content.json` file also.
@Zerov: I got the content.json file to download when I visited your zite - unlike before where it would fail to download. Now it's just stuck on a blank screen trying to load.
@Reke: I am also getting this issue.
I got a similar email from the same person: http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/12h51ug6CcntU2aiBjhP8Ns2e5VypbWWtv/12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu/1501083148
@Glightstar: That's what I was thinking too.
@Peeper: I think he's just answering questions mostly right now.

@Jayofthezero: *I believe* you can do desktop (not push) notifications without a Service Worker *with the restriction that the tab remains open* (in firefox at least). I think I told Glightstar: about this quite a while ago. People can start using this until we have some way to do push notifications (can't the client handle this by having zites register with the client just like how the new feed works?). https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/notification
link appears to be invalid. I'm wondering if there is a bug with the shortener zite, because you other link was invalid also.
@Styromaniac: This shortened link and the other one you posted say they are invalid for me. But other ones that I have clicked have not said that.
Thanks!

btw, the bug with the signing is fixed now. Before, Git Center was using your zeroid to sign your merger zite when you clicked the publish button, which is why you had to go to the merger zite and sign that way, so it uses your private key instead. However, Ivanq has fixed this with the latest update so that the blue sign and publish button always uses your private key now.
He isn't able to sign and publish it because last time he told me he isn't near the computer that has it (or something like that).
you can just do `git remote add name address/location`. Then do a force git push `git push name -f`. This is what I did with gitcenter.
No, I don't have problems uploading images. I don't get any prompt. However, if it's a new thing - I haven't updated Firefox Nightly in a few days. I'll test it out later, after updating.

@Binchan: You should be able to using the `comment and close` button on the issue page. I just did it on an issue on ZeroMedium repo and it worked for me. @Git Center: I have another request. Currently the only way to see if an issue is closed or not on the issue page is by noticing the color of the dot, which can sometimes be hard to distinguish quickly (especially for color blind people). It would not only help to determine if the issue is closed or not but also clean up the interface a little if you created separate sub-tabs for open and closed issues (and, if you want, a tab for all issues maybe) - or at least some type of filtering/organization.

@Binchan: Ah - yeah, wouldn't have got that because I was closing my own issue. That is helpful to know. @Git Center: I agree, I think the repo owner should be able to close and comment. I also think that the repo owner should be able to reopen issues too.
@Glightstar: I'm not sure why it's not working. The method he described is what I did for all of my repos (aside from having to recreate the bare git repo).

@Git Center: I was able to download the repo. The stuff in the log tab doesn't show up (continually says "Loading latest info", however, on the code tab, I can see the latest commit and the branch and all the files.
@Glightstar: Okay, now I can see some of the commits in the log tab. It's because it hasn't finished downloading I believe.
@Glightstar: Make sure you refresh, If you haven't already (which you probably have, but I'm just making sure).
@Glightstar: That should have popped up before it even shows your page, and thus before it redirects. That's what it did for me.

@Git Center: Because your not able to connect to any of the peers. That's something that I don't always understand with ZeroNet, but it happens quite a bit when a zite has low peer count. I think you just need to wait till more peers download the repo. I would have suggested to use bigcat.tk, however bigcat doesn't allow you to increase a zite's size limit yourself.
@Glightstar: @Git Center: I'm very unsure that that would help because even if you have the content.json file, you still need to be able to download the rest of the files.
@Glightstar: @Git Center: After waiting for the whole repo to download, I don't see anything anymore. This appeared to happen when the other branch showed up.
@Glightstar: @Git Center: Is it perhaps because the repo is so big and it just takes forever to load?

@Glightstar: @Git Center: I'm getting this error in the terminal:
```
Uncaught (in promise) File doesn't exist: merged-GitCenter/1EjXEyudstY8dN3F8V5od9KoS1bkAerz9x/thunderwave.git/objects/pack/pack-5796e45d59ffed6e3b1b89b6790e1c275b2f64fd.pack
```

It should also be noted that ZeroNet shows this as a missing file: `data/users/1CvyxRucf7BbDvGtFe5LayTS2qX88VN7Er/data.json`

@Glightstar: Yep, it's working for me now. @Git Center: It looks like there's a very small bug where if the branch name is too long to fit in just one line, it will overlap the next branch name listed.
@Glightstar: What the heck did you do? I'm wondering, how does removing a directory make all the commit-id's invalid?
@Glightstar: The data/users.json file never gets seeded, it has your private keys in there.
@Glightstar: Maybe he could have, but I've never know a `users.json` to be stored in a zite's data directory, but I'm not sure.
Yep, just released the new update. Haven't had a chance to create a post about it yet.
What do you mean?
@Binchan: I just realized that. What really confused me in the first place was that they seemed to have some of the same posts at first glance.

@BTC-E: I know what nofish's id is. noftsh looks very similar to nofish at first glance, so I think you can see my confusion. I'm not sure why your saying "please" when what I think/believe has no affect on you.
Sometimes this happens without realizing it because of library stuff.

I wouldn't recommend doing this because then the person would have to wait even longer to publish the message they just typed (20 seconds I think). I already get annoying after publishing something and waiting 20 seconds to publish another thing. *This would either double the time or if the person enters the message before the time is up to publish the change that tells others their typing, wouldn't tell others their typing because it will switch back right when they press enter (which means others won't know when someone's typing, making it useless in this case).*
The only other way is a centralized solution where you talk to a server on the clearnet.
@Git Center: It's *very* out of date. The person isn't managing it anymore, meaning we can't request things be added. And finally, it only has like 3 things on it, none of which I personally use.
@Git Center: For me, personally, I think white inputs would look too jarring. Perhaps they *could* be better with a lighter black/grey (but not a very light grey).
Apparently New York along with 16 other states are suing the FCC because of this (including the state where I live, Iowa).

You can turn off Firefox Shield in the options menu under `Nightly Data Collection and Use`. Also:
> There will be occasions where we might prompt you for participation first. This will happen when a particular study needs to collect data that is not covered by default data collection policy.  In these situations you'll see a complete disclosure of the data being collected in the study before you make the decision to participate.

[https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/lookingglass](https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/lookingglass)
> No changes will be made to Firefox unless you have opted in to this Alternate Reality Game.
@Binchan: I'm guessing you didn't see my my edit where I removed the stabe vs. nightly thing.
@Binchan: I think people exaggerate and blow things way out of proportion quite a lot, especially with browser and Operating System companies (Microsoft, Google, Mozilla).

@Binchan: And now you're basically saying that people are making all of this fuss because something *looks* like something it's not? And you're blaming Mozilla for that instead of the users who made these stupid assumptions? It's quite ridiculous in my view.

@Binchan: How about instead of focusing on all this petty crap, we start focusing on how terribly slow everything is? How about we start actually progressing and doing stuff rather than just complaining. Don't like current browsers, make a freaking new one instead of just complaining about it. That's just my point of view.
@Binchan: It's fine. I just hope people get my point that there are more important things to worry about than something like this.
I do also, if it wouldn't be too much trouble.

@Git Center: @styromaniac@zeroid.bit: Nofish said if you have multiple accounts, you can choose which account (hub) is being used (for example, for your following list). If you moved everything to one hub, then of course it won't show up.
@styromaniac@zeroid.bit: Did you tell @Nofish: that it didn't show up?

@styromaniac@zeroid.bit: Nofish never fixed that bug as far as I'm aware, I could be wrong though. He just added things to help with it (the profile selection thing and the other thing that just asks you if you want to continue if you already have a profile - it doesn't actually show your profile though afaik, although I'm not sure if that profile selection thing is supposed to help with that).

Also, his ZeroMe is a clone of official ZeroMe (with additions), which means it suffers from the same problems. He also might not have merged from the official repository after Nofish's fixes.

@styromaniac@zeroid.bit: It probably won't overwrite your database if you choose a hub that you don't already have a profile in (because that is what you did previously on official ZeroMe). However, I'm not sure about if you choose a hub you already have a profile on. I don't know if that will clear out the stuff in there or if it will just add the username, profile pic, and hub fields and just leave the rest of the stuff that is in there.

@空澄砂夜: I don't know if I like that part of the GFM specification. It makes not quoting text after a blockquote irritating for me because I always forget to put two new lines. To me, putting one new line should be breaking off from the blockquote, not inside the blockquote, that's just my opinion. To me it's more uniform if everything a part of a blockquote requires '>' before it's line.

Also, I think this is ambiguous in the original specification, but not sure about commonMark. GFM is not really *the* markdown standard, so you may want to check with commonMark.
@空澄砂夜: It's fine, I'll just have to get used to using two new lines. I now kinda understand why the newline works that way for blockquotes.

It's okay to be angry, especially when someone judges a comment based on how it looks rather than it's content. For the record, I wasn't angry until you made this exact judgement on my comment being a "tirade".
@Krixano: Oh, and by the way, I'm not arguing with you here, I'm just stressing the opposite of what you said is fine too.
Thanks!
@Kurikomoe: Playlist is a collection of songs. Genre is the type of song (rock, pop, etc.). You can make genres into playlists, but they are different.
@Zerolstnmobile: Considering that the songs I uploaded have msgpack files, it *should* be streaming. That's how it works for ZeroMedium.

@Zerolstnmobile: Yeah, with ZeroMedium, when I add the audio tag to the DOM it starts the streaming.

Also, from ZeroTalk:
> Okay, so on my own client, when I click a song it starts downloading. However, when I do the same thing on ZeroCat proxy, it doesn't start downloading and there's this error in the console:
> 
> > HTTP load failed with status 500. Load of media resource https://zerocat.eu/ZeroLSTN.bit/merged-ZeroLSTN/1Cf2PPFkvCTPFA7xyE21cA1houAM5Soy3F/data/users/12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu/01_-_Rolling_In_The_Deep-1515514118542.mp3 failed.
> 
> Also, ZeroCat has an icon while on my client, I still just see the regular ZeroNet icon.
@ZeroLSTN: It works for me now. I told you about that because I wasn't sure if I had an old version of the zite or not (because it was working on zerocat, just not locally).

I'm not sure it's possible without him changing ZeroHello and the NewsFeed plugin to allow for decrypting information that comes from the database, because all the NewsFeed does is run a database query on the zite's database and displays that information. Of course, I'm not sure if anything I just said above is 100% correct, so it'd be better if @Binchan: or someone more knowledgeable commented about this.

I think @Binchan: was doing something with ZeroMail stuff.

Also, @Git Center: created a python script that will run an email server (POP3 and SMTP) so you can get and send ZeroMail messages in an email client (like Thunderbird), called [ZeroMailProxy](https://github.com/imachug/ZeroMailProxy). He has another one for Thunderwave called [ThunderProxy](https://github.com/imachug/ThunderProxy) which works with irc clients (including Thunderbird as well).
Btw, somebody made a clone of ZeroLSTN because your zite was completely blank (couldn't download bundle.js for some reason).
I'm still having problems downloading the bundle.js I think. I'll wait it out a little though, to see if maybe it's just downloading slowly.
I got it downloaded just now.
@ZeroLSTN: Great work! Btw, I'm going to send you a ZeroMail about something soon.
If you are talking about Git Center zite, I believe you can if you are the owner. Edit: it's the "Comens and close issue" button - unless you are talking about if the issue itself disappears.
@ZeroLSTN: I've sent you the ZeroMail.

@ZeroLSTN: When you go to the issue, there should be a button at the very bottom next to the close button that says `comment and close issue`.

`Would be nice to close old bugs that have been long fixed in v2` - You *can*, that's what I'm saying.

I'll look into this when I have the time, because I was wondering a similar thing about why this was happening on your zite. I've gotten decent at finding and going around VueJs + ZeroFrame weridness.

@Jetten:
>  If you just embed the image, there's no mechanism to ask the user to add the site in order to display the image.

Yes there is. My Important Zites (new) has an example of this. It uses CORS to talk to other zites so you can search them - this requires asking the user for permission. However, if the user doesn't first add the zite, it also asks them to add the zite as well.

What I'd do, add a setting to embed images from another zite. When clicking to turn on, ask for CORS permission (adding zite if necessary). Then, whenever there's an image to show, either embed it if the setting was turned on, or just show the link to it.
I do have this feature in ZeroMedium, but nobody uses it.
@Glightstar: It's using the filter *property* rather than the *function* and it's on an SVG, so *I think* that is well supported.
@styromaniac@zeroid.bit: Yeah, the filter *property* works on elements and svg's, but not well supported as backdrop I think. The *function* isn't well supported.
I definitely agree, but I suck at making names, so yeah. I will be rebranding all of my zites soon anyways.
@Daniell Mesquita: I will welcome all suggestions and consider them, but I wont guarantee that I will use them. I do need new names for ZeroMedium, ZeroExchange, and Important Zites.
I'm currently considering some ideas of this, but the main problem for me would be the amount of time needed to keep it up.
It'd be better to add it as a tag when you add the zite on Important Zites. This also allows searching for it.
Just added the tag for KxoNetwork. Now, if you search for "PeerMessage" on Important Zites or KxoNetwork's search it will show up.
So far, the only zites I know that use PeerMessage is KxoNetwork and a few unreleased ones.

@Styromaniac: I think it's more about what gender the bike should be *for*, rather than what the bike's gender is. Anyways, I agree with you that it's pretty dumb.
Where I am, I think this would be considered more of a boys bike because it is blue.

@Kaffie: Because it doesn't actually make sense scientifically. A lot of these "norms/roles" are not science based, and they allow people to make assumptions about someone that may or may not be true. Men get bullied for crying, for liking pink, etc. I don't think that's okay.
@Kaffie: Well, if you allow people to go out of the norms, then there aren't really any norms, are there?
@Kaffie: Hmm... not true. More than LGBT people fall out of line of norms. I don't like sports, though I'm a man.

@Kaffie: So you are going by *majority*. I'm going by *everything*. If you do not perfectly line up with the norms of a man, are you a man? idk... But I do know that you still fall out of line of the norms of the man if even just a little.

@Kaffie: The whole notion of men are supposed to be this way and women are supposed to be this other way is completely stupid and makes absolutely no sense. Women can wear mens clothes, but men can't wear womens. Men do cry. Many men don't like sports. Many men are what would be called "motherly". Many men aren't strong. Many men aren't geeks. etc. etc. So saying that men are these things is just outright *false*. Hence why the notion of these "norms" make no sense. Additionally, science says men and women are more similar than what one might think.
Imo, everyone should be *people*.. that's it. Because saying men are this way is false, because many men probably aren't that way. It's the globalization that's the problem.

That is, unless we talk about **sex** rather than gender. In which case, people are Men, Women, or Both based on their sexual organs. These words should *not* hold **any** assumptions about the person aside from what sex organs they have, that's just my opinion
Now roles, I'm fine with as long as each role is small enough to only stand for one unit of characteristics. I'm a programmer, I program.
And this isn't even getting into how women and men being a certain way are dictated by the norms, not the other way around
@Kaffie: No, because men are the way they are **because** of the norms! Science has proven this already.
@Kaffie: Nobody's trying to abolish norms, they are trying to abolish the perception of norms.

@Kaffie: They've found cultures where the norms of men and women are completely opposite. This tells us that these norm's aren't because when born, men's brain's make them more apt to behave one way, but that their behavior, etc. conforms to the norms of the *culture*.
@Kaffie: That's exactly what I'm meaning. Ignore the norms, abolish harrasment.
No I read what you wrote, I just don't know if I agree. Don't mistake not reading for disagreeing

`They conform with peers of the same sex. ` Having people that fall out of line proves otherwise. In science, you can't just say a statement like this if it's only *partially* true, unless you make the statement more specific.

@Kaffie: Ok... There are men who don't like sports. Basically all men cry at least one point in their lifetime. Many men aren't geeks. Many men like "girl sports". The list goes on... That just proves that the statement is only **partially** true, which makes the statement defunct. You can't just say something is completely true, when it's only partially true. And personal experience is hardly scientific.

"Personally speaking, I don't know of any non-LGBT people that incorrectly engage with social norms" - I know a lot of people who don't fall in line exactly with the norms.
@Kaffie: Those are stereotypes that are typically referred to as the norm for men. The norm for men **is** a stereotype.
Also, there's a norm in the US that men don't cry and shouldn't cry.
How would you get it back though, with refresh? Also, doesn't seem to work for me (unless it was just added in a new revision in the past couple of days).

@猫叉酱（小号）: No, it's real. See @nofish: 's [ZeroBlog post](/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:138:%22The+Vacation%22+Sandbox+escape+bug+[Reported+by+GitCenter+/+Krixano+/+ZeroLSTN]). If you have ZeroUpdate downloaded, the button on ZeroHello to update will use ZeroUpdate. If you don't, then it will use GitHub.
It uses UPnP, afaik
Don't forget about [KxoVid](/kxovid.bit)! Actually, I'm just wondering... is there something you think is missing/lacking from KxoVid?

@Styromaniac: You've tried it recently? You've downloaded the Categories from the Categories page? Not everyone has this problem - as you can see on ZeroTalk. I've also been fixing a lot of bugs recently. Btw, it's appreciated that you actually tell me about these bugs instead of just not letting the developer know and continue on working on something that's not working for other people.
@Styromaniac: KxoVid doesn't need the plugin. KxoNetwork does only to register. However, I've already added ZeroId support to KxoVid (so you don't need a KxoId).
@Styromaniac: YAY! Thank God.... I was *really* hoping it wasn't yet another weird bug.

@Styromaniac: Btw, I haven't yet give a notification on this yet - you need to first create a channel before you can upload. You can do this by clicking your user icon/name in the top bar and clicking "Create Channel". I'm actually going to work on this *now* - when no channels have been created, then the upload page will simply tell you to create a channel first.
Yeah, I don't have a (clearnet) website anymore. I probably won't continue it either.
@Styromaniac: Other people had trouble with this, which is why I'm going to add some type of notice or something on the upload page.
@Styromaniac: The Upload link/button? What button are you talking about?
@Styromaniac: Upload link in the sidebar (on mobile), or the Top bar (desktop - cloud icon)? Or somewhere else? Sorry, I have multiple places where I link to the upload page.

@Styromaniac: Nvm, found it (on the channel settings page). Already fixed. Will publish in a minute. Thanks for your help!
Btw, I have very poor upload speed, so it may take a while before you receive the update.
This has been fixed. See my other comment.
Did you get the update? Is it working now?

@Styromaniac: Hm.... yeah, sometimes I have trouble downloading some categories too, because of a peer problem or something, idk. I'm not really sure what to do about this.
(If you click to Download/Add, but it doesn't actually add, then it's usually because it's failing to download because of peers or not being signed, etc. You can see this also if you copy the address and go directly to the merger zite.)
@Styromaniac: I've just resigned and republished the Science & Technology Merger Category, *maybe* that'll help, idk.

@Styromaniac: Right... because the merger zites not downloading. Or wait... do you get any notification that it's adding it or a notification to click "Add"? Also, are you clicking the "Download" link or the link of the title of the category.
@Styromaniac: Ok. And you've clicked the "Download" link just below the categories description? That's odd....

@Styromaniac: Ok, analogies aren't needed. I just need you to answer *all* of my questions. Clearly this only happens sometimes (meaning in particular circumstances), and not all of the time, otherwise I would have already caught it.
@Styromaniac: And again... are you clicking the **download** link? I've asked this multiple times, and you haven't given me an answer to this yet.
@Styromaniac: Ok. Weird.... Hold on.
@Styromaniac: What browser and OS?

@Styromaniac: Ok, Thanks. I'm adding a different thing at the moment, but I'll try to look into this afterwards (in a few minutes). You can work around this right now by copying the address shown under the category title in the categories list and putting that in the address bar.

@Styromaniac: How? You are just downloading a zite. You are doing `127.0.0.1:43110/[address of category here]` right? Or is it just failing to download the zite? (if so, that's a problem with peers or the zite not being signed - so I can't actually help that)
@Styromaniac: Science and Technology actually isn't empty.

@Styromaniac: Btw, just as a forewarning, the "Delete" button (on the categories page) does absolutely nothing, even though it gives you a notification. This is because that API call isn't even implemented in the ZeroNet client. I or someone should make an issue on this on ZeroNet's GitHub.

@Styromaniac: I've just released a small update to fix something. Basically, now when you click on a category *title* (on the categories page) when it's not downloaded, it will (or rather, *should*) download (as if you clicked the "Download" link). Some people were clicking on the title without clicking on the "Download" link first.

@Styromaniac: Also, thanks a lot for your help! Yeah, it's late, but I'm usually up at night and asleep during the day on the weekends. (I'm in CST, so it's 2:32AM here)
I wish chrome mobile had a dev tools thing so you can see error messages in a console.

@Styromaniac: Btw, that zite is *really good*.

Also, there's a thing you mentioned previously that Video Sharing zites should do. I'm going to be working on adding it. This is just a little hint.

@Styromaniac: Yay! Thanks. The *very first* 4K video on KxoVid! (is it that 4K video you mentioned previously that you are posting right now?) Crossing my fingers that there's no problems uploading the video now. Also, thanks for your patience while I sort stuff out. Goodnight!

@Styromaniac: Ok. I seen you uploaded the video. But now I'm seeing this problem again that comes up rarely/occasionally. I cannot get fileInfo of the video file, which is why peer count doesn't show up. Either it's because I havened downloaded your updated content.json file, or something else, idk...
@Styromaniac: I don't think I see an invalid character.... Hm...

@Styromaniac: Idk if you want to go to bed right now or continue until this is fixed, but whenever you get the chance, can you check in your data folder under 1GWai (the Science & Technology zite) and see if a .piecemap.msgpack file is in there.
@Styromaniac: Wait... Hyphens cause problems?
@Styromaniac: I already do that, but I just don't know if I forgot to sanitize one or not. All I see are uppercase, lowercase, hyphens, underscores, and numbers for the filename of your video.

@Styromaniac: Wait, you are right! There are parentheses! I'll get those sanitized. Then, if you don't mind, I'll delete your video and you can delete the video file and piecemap in your folder, and reupload the video.
(Or you can try renaming the file, but you'll also have to make sure to rename the piecemap as the exact same and edit your data.json to match the new filename)

@Styromaniac:I was already sanitizing some things, just not parentheses (lol).
I'm *so* happy I got this bug figured out. Ok, so I've deleted the video from your data.json file. Now, delete your video file and piecemap from your users folder. Then reupload. I've also published the update to KxoVid, so make sure it says updated 5 minutes ago (or around there) and that it's not still trying to download 1 of the files.

> Is there way to prevent this since very few people know of this? Do you think this is fixable from the python side of it?
I'm not sure. Apparently Nofish does this because according to the spec (rfc), url's are only allowed certain characters? idk....
But having the zite sanitize the filename works for now - even though it's kinda sucky because a filename with all chinese characters will essentially turn into just the number I append to filenames (to make sure they are unique).
@Styromaniac: Are you able to play it?

@Styromaniac: For some reason, ZeroNet doesn't want to download the file or something. I'm not even seeing it showing as trying to download in the sidebar of Science and Tech zite. I'm able to get file info now though (peer count, etc.)
This is actually a problem for all devices right now. I'm probably going to switch to a different player library (perhaps video.js)
@Styromaniac: It's because your piecemap shows 0 peers. Wierd.
@Krixano: Oh, wait... I currently have 0 trackers.
@Styromaniac: Ok. It's working!!!!!! Thanks *so much* for your help!

@Deliriumgoddess6: If you cannot use ZeroId to sign in to KxoVid, then the zite might not have updated for you, idk... On ZeroHello, the zite should say it was updated *11 hours ago*. Secondly, the namecoin kxovid.bit does not work correctly (due to *someone else* incorrectly registering the name) - therefore you must register for a kxoid here: [/1GTVetvjTEriCMzKzWSP9FahYoMPy6BG1P/?/create-id](/1GTVetvjTEriCMzKzWSP9FahYoMPy6BG1P/?/create-id)

@Deliriumgoddess6: Because KxoNetwork is where you register for a KxoId - It would get too confusing if I allowed signing in to KxoNetwork with ZeroId, imo. Additionally, the only thing KxoNetwork provides that requires signing in is uploading of plugins. Everything else should work without signing in (although, now that I think about it, I need to fix some things).
